content.rendered: Lisa Lowell has been singing live and in-studio with Bruce Springsteen since 1990.

yoast_head:
<!-- This site is optimized with the Yoast SEO plugin v25.2 - https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/seo/ -->
<title>Lisa Lowell | Bruce Springsteen</title>
<meta name="description" content="Lisa Lowell has been singing live and in-studio with Bruce Springsteen since 1990. Following studies at New England Conservatory of Music, the New Jersey native moved to New York City, where she began singing in the streets with Patti Scialfa; soon after, they met Soozie Tyrell and toured as a trio with Southside Johnny & the Asbury Jukes. Lisa also toured and recorded with Buster Pointdexter (aka former New York Dolls vocalist David Johansen) for over a decade. Lisa has sung on numerous Springsteen albums, starting with 1992’s Lucky Town, as well as records by Scialfa, Tyrell, and Southside Johnny & the Asbury Jukes." />

Lisa also toured and recorded with Buster Pointdexter (aka former New York Dolls vocalist David Johansen) for over a decade. Lisa has sung on numerous Springsteen albums, starting with 1992’s Lucky Town, as well as records by Scialfa, Tyrell, and Southside Johnny & the Asbury Jukes." />

yoast_head_json.title: Lisa Lowell | Bruce Springsteen
yoast_head_json.description: Lisa Lowell has been singing live and in-studio with Bruce Springsteen since 1990. Following studies at New England Conservatory of Music, the New Jersey native moved to New York City, where she began singing in the streets with Patti Scialfa; soon after, they met Soozie Tyrell and toured as a trio with Southside Johnny & the Asbury Jukes. Lisa also toured and recorded with Buster Pointdexter (aka former New York Dolls vocalist David Johansen) for over a decade. Lisa has sung on numerous Springsteen albums, starting with 1992’s Lucky Town, as well as records by Scialfa, Tyrell, and Southside Johnny & the Asbury Jukes.

Following studies at New England Conservatory of Music, the New Jersey native moved to New York City, where she began singing in the streets with Patti Scialfa; soon after, they met Soozie Tyrell and toured as a trio with Southside Johnny & the Asbury Jukes. Lisa also toured and recorded with Buster Pointdexter (aka former New York Dolls vocalist David Johansen) for over a decade. Lisa has sung on numerous Springsteen albums, starting with 1992’s Lucky Town, as well as records by Scialfa, Tyrell, and Southside Johnny & the Asbury Jukes.

Lisa also toured and recorded with Buster Pointdexter (aka former New York Dolls vocalist David Johansen) for over a decade.
